title: Leuza
content:
Leuza (Russian: Леуза́; Bashkir: Ләүйылға, Läwyılğa) is a rural locality (a selo) and the administrative centre of Leuzinsky Selsoviet, Kiginsky District, Bashkortostan, Russia. The population was 1,076 as of 2010.[2] There are 11 streets.

Leuza is located 17 km northeast of Verkhniye Kigi (the district's administrative centre) by road. Verkhniye Kigi is the nearest rural locality.[3]

This Kiginsky District location article is a stub. You can help Wikipedia by expanding it.
